title: Quasinormal modes of black holes embedded in halos of matter
authors: Laura Pezzella, Kyriakos Destounis, Andrea Maselli and Vitor Cardoso
abstract:
We investigate the (axial) quasinormal modes of black holes embedded in
generic matter profiles. Our results reveal that the axial QNMs experience a
redshift when the black hole is surrounded by various matter environments,
proportional to the compactness of the matter halo. Our calculations
demonstrate that for static black holes embedded in galactic matter
distributions, there exists a universal relation between the matter environment
and the redshifted vacuum quasinormal modes. In particular, for dilute
environments the leading order effect is a redshift $1+U$ of frequencies and
damping times, with $U \sim -{\cal C}$ the Newtonian potential of the
environment at its center, which scales with its compactness ${\cal C}$.
